Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater or dinos; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of Herakles (part of head, upper body, and left arm remaining; added red on beard; lion’s skin over head and knotted on chest, with added white on claws; faded white or red straps crossing below knot) to right, with left arm extended behind Amazon’s neck; at right, Amazon to left (head and part of upper body remaining; white on flesh; high-crested helmet with white on outer band of crest; shield with red edge and white tripod device; spear).
Curator's comments: The Amazon may be in rear view or perhaps retreating to the right, looking back.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.43)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 363, no. B477)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0172) (Phase 1)
